article.headline: Pacific 64, Hawaii 54
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. -- Khalil Kelley had career highs of 15 points and 13 rebounds to lead Pacific to a 64-54 victory over Hawaii on Tuesday night. The sophomore center dominated inside to record his first double-double and help Pacific avenge a 75-70 loss at Hawaii on Nov. 25. Lorenzo McCloud added nine points and seven assists for Pacific (4-3), which recorded its second win in four days over a Western Athletic Conference opponent. Joston Thomas led Hawaii (2-4) with 11 points and nine rebounds. Vander Joaquim added 10 points and six rebounds. Pacific never trailed after taking the lead with a 9-0 run late in the first half. Hawaii cut a nine-point Pacific advantage to 48-46 with 8:44 remaining, but the Tigers responded with a 10-0 spurt to take their biggest lead of the game. Kelley highlighted the run with a three-point play followed by a basket inside. Kelley made all seven of his shots from the field and also blocked two shots.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
